newsitem.title: USA: Global Intellicom expects profit this year.
newsitem.headline: Global Intellicom expects profit this year.

text.p: Global Intellicom Inc said Friday it expects to turn a profit this year after losing more than $1 million in 1996.

The company said it lost more than $1.6 million in the first quarter of 1997, but deals struck recently with International Business Machines Corp and Sun Microsystems Inc will contribute toward positive year-end earnings.

Global, a computer software and hardware producer, said it expects that revenues for 1997 could exceed $100 million, with most of it coming in the third and fourth quarters. First quarter revenues were $11.1 million, it said.
Global said its Speech Solutions Inc unit has a deal to be IBM's sole provider of voice tools for use with IBM's voice-type speech engine.

Global said its Nevcor Inc unit has a deal to become an authorized Sun workstations distributor. The deal also names Global as a builder of Sun workstations. The machines will be sold with Sun support, but under a private label, it said.
Another subsidiary, Natcom Inc, has been named as a reseller of Sun's Solaris and Java workstations systems.
